txt.en: 'You will go no further, little ones!'
Martial Movement
The Final Word
A meticulously-compiled old tome that provides an analysis of skin-changers, including those of the House of Beorn, in Middle-earth.
'My faithful servants, you have stood watch over this hall for long enough.'
'Cast off that old stone and spread your wings!'
'Break free at last... I release you!'
'You wish to enter the hallowed citadel? Come, then!'
'None may oppose the Witch-queen of Angmar!'
'You shall learn soon enough of your folly, little ones.'
'I have more weapons in my armoury!'
'Your wills shall break like twigs underfoot, and you will beg to serve the Iron Crown.'
Lore of the Blade
'I swear now an oath upon this stone: I serve Angmar now and forever!'
'Only a fool never changes his strategy!'
A meticulously-compiled old tome containing writings on a number of essays in bare-handed fighting and methods of movement commonly used by Brawlers.
'Behold the power of the Witch-queen of Angmar! You, too, shall serve!'
A meticulously-compiled old tome thought to have first been scribed by an ancient Rune-keeper in the service of King Durin. It is thought to contain many secrets passed down from the First Age.
A meticulously-compiled tome telling of a secret power Guardians of old once used to bind their enemies in an Oath of battle to the death.
<rgb=#00FF00>With the Iron Crown Sorcerer's defeat, the fell spirits vanish and a path deeper into Gwathrenost opens!</rgb>
'You amuse me, little ones. Let us even the odds!'
'You call yourselves Krahjarn?! Get out here, you maggots!'
Thunder and Flame
<rgb=#FF0000>Tauressar turns its malice upon you!</rgb>
'Heal me, sluggards, or I'll have your heads!'
A meticulously-compiled old tome of inspiring songs penned by Minstrels of the Free Peoples during the Second Age of Middle-earth.
'Come forth, my servants!'
'The realm of Angmar is mine to command!'
'Come, let us slay them together!'
A Study of the Skin-changer
'The Trév Duvárdain will be victorious!'
'They must've gotten Gurkrak. It's up to us now, boys!'
'Enough!'
'But I... swore....'
'I bid you welcome, my esteemed guests.'
'You must forgive the condition of these halls, for they have languished in my absence.'
'Alas, you have arrived earlier than my master anticipated.'
'Attendants! Your services are needed.'
'It is no matter. All will be set to rights soon enough.'
'My guests demand more and I would not deny them!'
'It seems I shall have to entertain you myself!'
'I swear now an oath upon this stone: I serve Angmar now and forever!'
'I must call upon you again, my attendants!'
<rgb=#FF0000>Nearing its destruction, Tauressar calls upon the Dead to honour their oaths!</rgb>
A Shot In The Dark
'Crannog!'
The Tome of Swords
'What's all this racket about?'
'It seems we have rats in the castle...'
'Do you not see? It is too late.'
Ásachal[fn]
'Once these Hill-men served the Witch-king, but now I am their master.'
'Such is the only purpose of weak-willed Men.'
'In time, all will bow to the Witch-queen of Angmar.'
'It is time, Claghórd. Tauressar beckons to us!'
'For this kingdom will flourish anew and Angmar itself will be reborn!'
'Máltagar, I command you, unleash the power of Tauressar!'
Gwathrenost, the Witch-king's Citadel
'Perhaps you remain unconvinced?'
'Why do you resist me?!'
<rgb=#00FF00>The shard of Tauressar shimmers as its defences fall!</rgb>
'So be it!'
'It cannot be...'
'No! Noooo!'
A meticulously-compiled old tome detailing the exploits of a renowned knife-fighter and Burglar.
The Watch Against the Night
A meticulously-compiled old tome warning of the power and sanctity of the Captain's Oath, and the dire fate that awaits those who might break them....
'I... failed you... my queen...'
'How... rude....'
A meticulously-compiled old tome describing the fictional account of an adventurous young Lore-master and her companions as they adventure across Middle-earth.
<rgb=#FF0000>By some unseen hand, the doors slam behind you!</rgb>
'We are... betrayed....'
<rgb=#FF0000>You feel a chill as more spirits descend from higher in Gwathrenost!</rgb>
A Guiding Star
The Book of Oaths
A meticulously-compiled old tome describing the watch kept by the ancient Wardens of Gondolin during the years of the long wars against Morgoth.
A meticulously-compiled old tome authored by Champions of ages long past detailing feats of swordsmanship and heroism.
I tire of these hollow pleasantries. Perhaps a more formal welcome is in order!'
A meticulously-compiled old tome authored by Mariners of ages long past detailing methods of navigation by observing the stars and constellations of Middle-earth.
You must have completed 'Discovery: Carn Dûm' by travelling to Bail Avarc in Angmar to play this instance.
'High Chieftain, deal with these intruders!'
'Do as you are told, Claghórd!'
'You are mistaken.'
A meticulously-compiled old tome describing the art of a lone Hunter who once stalked Mirkwood, slaying goblins and spiders alike with unmatched skill.
'You were mine long before we returned to Angmar.'
'Now, then...'
'That is far enough.'
<rgb=#FF0000>With your flight or defeat, the Iron Crown renews their defences in Gwathrenost!</rgb>
The Book of Knives
'None may disturb the Witch-queen of Angmar.'
'But I would be pleased to welcome you in her stead.'
'What say you?'
'You will go no further! The secrets of the Witch-queen are forbidden to the unsworn!'
'Let us hope you've got more fight in you than old Crannog!'
<rgb=#FF0000>A chill washes over you as  fell spirits descend to hinder your ascent of Gwathrenost!</rgb>
'I do not answer to you, Ásachal.'
'I swore loyalty to Angmar, not to you!'
The Rising Chord
'What?!'
'You are unworthy of Tauressar's blessing!'
